channel.title: registry_event on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in registry_event on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Enable Microsoft Dynamic Data Exchange
item.description: Enable Dynamic Data Exchange protocol (DDE) in all supported editions of Microsoft Word or Excel.

item.title: CrashControl CrashDump Disabled
item.description: Detects disabling the CrashDump per registry (as used by HermeticWiper)

item.title: Use IE Registry for Persistence
item.description: Use IE registry to hide a scripts

item.title: Blackbyte Ransomware Registry
item.description: BlackByte set three different registry values to escalate privileges and begin setting the stage for lateral movement and encryption

item.title: IE Change Domain Zone
item.description: Hides the file extension through modification of the registry

item.title: Registry Modification to Hidden File Extension
item.description: Hides the file extension through modification of the registry

item.title: Disable Administrative Share Creation at Startup
item.description: Administrative shares are hidden network shares created by Microsoftâ€™s Windows NT operating systems that grant system administrators remote access to every disk volume on a network-connected system

item.title: Add Port Monitor Persistence in Registry
item.description: Adversaries may use port monitors to run an attacker supplied DLL during system boot for persistence or privilege escalation. A port monitor can be set through the AddMonitor API call to set a DLL to be loaded at startup.

item.title: Registry Key Creation or Modification for Shim DataBase
item.description: Adversaries may establish persistence and/or elevate privileges by executing malicious content triggered by application shims. The Microsoft Windows Application Compatibility Infrastructure/Framework (Application Shim) was created to allow for backward compatibility of software as the operating system codebase changes over time

item.title: Winlogon Notify Key Logon Persistence
item.description: Adversaries may abuse features of Winlogon to execute DLLs and/or executables when a user logs in. Winlogon.exe is a Windows component responsible for actions at logon/logoff as well as the secure attention sequence (SAS) triggered by Ctrl-Alt-Delete.

item.title: Change Outlook Security Setting in Registry
item.description: Change outlook email security settings

item.title: Running Chrome VPN Extensions via the Registry 2 VPN Extension
item.description: Running Chrome VPN Extensions via the Registry install 2 vpn extension

item.title: New File Association Using Exefile
item.description: Detects the abuse of the exefile handler in new file association. Used for bypass of security products.

item.title: Registry Persistence Mechanisms in Recycle Bin
item.description: Detects persistence registry keys for Recycle Bin

item.title: NetWire RAT Registry Key
item.description: Attempts to detect registry events for common NetWire key HKCU\Software\NetWire

item.title: Terminal Server Client Connection History Cleared
item.description: Detects the deletion of registry keys containing the MSTSC connection history

item.title: Windows Defender Real-Time Protection Disabled
item.description: Detects disabling Windows Defender Real-Time Protection by modifying registry

item.title: DNS-over-HTTPS Enabled by Registry
item.description: Detects when a user enables DNS-over-HTTPS. This can be used to hide internet activity or be used to hide the process of exfiltrating data. With this enabled organization will lose visibility into data such as query type, response and originating IP that are used to determine bad actors.

item.title: Shell Open Registry Keys Manipulation
item.description: Detects the shell open key manipulation (exefile and ms-settings) used for persistence and the pattern of UAC Bypass using fodhelper.exe, computerdefaults.exe, slui.exe via registry keys (e.g. UACMe 33 or 62)

item.title: UAC Bypass Abusing Winsat Path Parsing - Registry
item.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using a path parsing issue in winsat.exe (UACMe 52)

item.title: UAC Bypass Using Windows Media Player - Registry
item.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using Windows Media Player osksupport.dll (UACMe 32)

item.title: CVE-2021-31979 CVE-2021-33771 Exploits by Sourgum
item.description: Detects patterns as noticed in exploitation of Windows CVE-2021-31979 CVE-2021-33771 vulnerability and DevilsTongue malware by threat group Sourgum

item.title: Outlook C2 Registry Key
item.description: Detects the modification of Outlook Security Setting to allow unprompted execution. Goes with win_outlook_c2_macro_creation.yml and is particularly interesting if both events occur near to each other.

item.title: Stealthy VSTO Persistence
item.description: Detects persistence via Visual Studio Tools for Office (VSTO) add-ins in Office applications.

item.title: WINEKEY Registry Modification
item.description: Detects potential malicious modification of run keys by winekey or team9 backdoor

item.title: Office Application Startup - Office Test
item.description: Detects the addition of office test registry that allows a user to specify an arbitrary DLL that will be executed every time an Office application is started

item.title: COM Hijack via Sdclt
item.description: Detects changes to ‘HKCU\Software\Classes\Folder\shell\open\command\DelegateExecute’

item.title: Suspicious New Printer Ports in Registry (CVE-2020-1048)
item.description: Detects a new and suspicious printer port creation in Registry that could be an attempt to exploit CVE-2020-1048

item.title: Windows Registry Persistence COM Search Order Hijacking
item.description: Detects potential COM object hijacking leveraging the COM Search Order

item.title: Windows Registry Trust Record Modification
item.description: Alerts on trust record modification within the registry, indicating usage of macros

item.title: Windows Credential Editor Registry
item.description: Detects the use of Windows Credential Editor (WCE)

item.title: Windows Registry Persistence COM Key Linking
item.description: Detects COM object hijacking via TreatAs subkey

item.title: Narrator's Feedback-Hub Persistence
item.description: Detects abusing Windows 10 Narrator’s Feedback-Hub

item.title: RDP Registry Modification
item.description: Detects potential malicious modification of the property value of fDenyTSConnections and UserAuthentication to enable remote desktop connections.

item.title: DLL Load via LSASS
item.description: Detects a method to load DLL via LSASS process using an undocumented Registry key

item.title: Suspicious Keyboard Layout Load
item.description: Detects the keyboard preload installation with a suspicious keyboard layout, e.g. Chinese, Iranian or Vietnamese layout load in user session on systems maintained by US staff only

item.title: OceanLotus Registry Activity
item.description: Detects registry keys created in OceanLotus (also known as APT32) attacks

item.title: Ursnif
item.description: Detects new registry key created by Ursnif malware.

item.title: Usage of Sysinternals Tools
item.description: Detects the usage of Sysinternals Tools due to accepteula key being added to Registry

item.title: CMSTP Execution Registry Event
item.description: Detects various indicators of Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer execution

item.title: NetNTLM Downgrade Attack
item.description: Detects NetNTLM downgrade attack

item.title: Sticky Key Like Backdoor Usage
item.description: Detects the usage and installation of a backdoor that uses an option to register a malicious debugger for built-in tools that are accessible in the login screen

item.title: DHCP Callout DLL Installation
item.description: Detects the installation of a Callout DLL via CalloutDlls and CalloutEnabled parameter in Registry, which can be used to execute code in context of the DHCP server (restart required)

item.title: UAC Bypass via Event Viewer
item.description: Detects UAC bypass method using Windows event viewer

item.title: UAC Bypass via Sdclt
item.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using registry key manipulation of sdclt.exe (e.g. UACMe 53)

item.title: Abusing Windows Telemetry For Persistence
item.description: Windows telemetry makes use of the binary CompatTelRunner.exe to run a variety of commands and perform the actual telemetry collections. This binary was created to be easily extensible, and to that end, it relies on the registry to instruct on which commands to run. The problem is, it will run any arbitrary command without restriction of location or type.

item.title: Atbroker Registry Change
item.description: Detects creation/modification of Assisitive Technology applications and persistence with usage of ATs

item.title: Bypass UAC Using DelegateExecute
item.description: Bypasses User Account Control using a fileless method

item.title: Bypass UAC Using Event Viewer
item.description: Bypasses User Account Control using Event Viewer and a relevant Windows Registry modification

item.title: Bypass UAC Using SilentCleanup Task
item.description: There is an auto-elevated task called SilentCleanup located in %windir%\system32\cleanmgr.exe This can be abused to elevate any file with Administrator privileges without prompting UAC

item.title: Changing RDP Port to Non Standard Number
item.description: Remote desktop is a common feature in operating systems. It allows a user to log into an interactive session with a system desktop graphical user interface on a remote system. Microsoft refers to its implementation of the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) as Remote Desktop Services (RDS).

item.title: CobaltStrike Service Installations in Registry
item.description: Detects known malicious service installs that appear in cases in which a Cobalt Strike beacon elevates privileges or lateral movement. We can also catch this by system log 7045 (https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma/blob/master/rules/windows/builtin/win_cobaltstrike_service_installs.yml) In some SIEM you can catch those events also in HKLM\System\ControlSet001\Services or HKLM\System\ControlSet002\Services, however, this rule is based on a regular sysmon’s events.

item.title: COMPlus_ETWEnabled Registry Modification
item.description: Potential adversaries stopping ETW providers recording loaded .NET assemblies.

item.title: Creation of a Local Hidden User Account by Registry
item.description: Sysmon registry detection of a local hidden user account.

item.title: Disable Exploit Guard Network Protection on Windows Defender
item.description: Detects disabling Windows Defender Exploit Guard Network Protection

item.title: Disable Microsoft Defender Firewall via Registry
item.description: Adversaries may disable or modify system firewalls in order to bypass controls limiting network usage

item.title: Disable Microsoft Office Security Features
item.description: Disable Microsoft Office Security Features by registry

item.title: Disable PUA Protection on Windows Defender
item.description: Detects disabling Windows Defender PUA protection

item.title: Disable Tamper Protection on Windows Defender
item.description: Detects disabling Windows Defender Tamper Protection

item.title: Disable UAC Using Registry
item.description: Disable User Account Conrol (UAC) by changing its registry key HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System\EnableLUA from 1 to 0

item.title: DNS ServerLevelPluginDll Install
item.description: Detects the installation of a plugin DLL via ServerLevelPluginDll parameter in Registry, which can be used to execute code in context of the DNS server (restart required)

item.title: Enabling COR Profiler Environment Variables
item.description: This rule detects cor_enable_profiling and cor_profiler environment variables being set and configured.

item.title: Esentutl Volume Shadow Copy Service Keys
item.description: Detects the volume shadow copy service initialization and processing via esentutl. Registry keys such as HKLM\System\CurrentControlSet\Services\VSS\Diag\VolSnap\Volume are captured.

item.title: Execution DLL of Choice Using WAB.EXE
item.description: This rule detects that the path to the DLL written in the registry is different from the default one. Launched WAB.exe tries to load the DLL from Registry.

item.title: HybridConnectionManager Service Installation
item.description: Detects the installation of the Azure Hybrid Connection Manager service to allow remote code execution from Azure function.

item.title: Leviathan Registry Key Activity
item.description: Detects registry key used by Leviathan APT in Malaysian focused campaign

item.title: Logon Scripts (UserInitMprLogonScript) Registry
item.description: Detects creation or execution of UserInitMprLogonScript persistence method

item.title: New Application in AppCompat
item.description: A General detection for a new application in AppCompat. This indicates an application executing for the first time on an endpoint.

item.title: New TaskCache Entry
item.description: Monitor the creation of a new key under ‘TaskCache’ when a new scheduled task is registered

item.title: Office Security Settings Changed
item.description: Detects registry changes to Office macro settings. The TrustRecords contain information on executed macro-enabled documents. (see references)

item.title: Pandemic Registry Key
item.description: Detects Pandemic Windows Implant

item.title: Path To Screensaver Binary Modified
item.description: Detects value modification of registry key containing path to binary used as screensaver.

item.title: Persistent Outlook Landing Pages
item.description: Detects the manipulation of persistent URLs which could execute malicious code

item.title: Persistent Outlook Landing Pages
item.description: Detects the manipulation of persistent URLs which can be malicious

item.title: PortProxy Registry Key
item.description: Detects the modification of PortProxy registry key which is used for port forwarding. For command execution see rule win_netsh_port_fwd.yml.

item.title: PowerShell as a Service in Registry
item.description: Detects that a powershell code is written to the registry as a service.

item.title: PrinterNightmare Mimimkatz Driver Name
item.description: Detects static QMS 810 and mimikatz driver name used by Mimikatz as exploited in CVE-2021-1675 and CVE-2021-34527

item.title: RDP Sensitive Settings Changed
item.description: Detects changes to RDP terminal service sensitive settings

item.title: RedMimicry Winnti Playbook Registry Manipulation
item.description: Detects actions caused by the RedMimicry Winnti playbook

item.title: Registry Entries For Azorult Malware
item.description: Detects the presence of a registry key created during Azorult execution

item.title: Registry Persistence Mechanism via Windows Telemetry
item.description: Detects persistence method using windows telemetry

item.title: Removal Amsi Provider Reg Key
item.description: Remove the AMSI Provider registry key in HKLM\Software\Microsoft\AMSI to disable AMSI inspection

item.title: Removal of Potential COM Hijacking Registry Keys
item.description: A General detection to trigger for processes removing .*\shell\open\command registry keys. Registry keys that might have been used for COM hijacking activities.

item.title: Run Once Task Configuration in Registry
item.description: Rule to detect the configuration of Run Once registry key. Configured payload can be run by runonce.exe /AlternateShellStartup

item.title: ServiceDll Modification
item.description: Detects the modification of a ServiceDLL value in the service settings

item.title: SilentProcessExit Monitor Registrytion
item.description: Detects changes to the Registry in which a monitor program gets registered to monitor the exit of another process

item.title: SilentProcessExit Monitor Registrytion for LSASS
item.description: Detects changes to the Registry in which a monitor program gets registered to dump process memory of the lsass.exe process memory

item.title: Suspicious Camera and Microphone Access
item.description: Detects Processes accessing the camera and microphone from suspicious folder

item.title: Suspicious Printer Driver Empty Manufacturer
item.description: Detects a suspicious printer driver installation with an empty Manufacturer value

item.title: Suspicious Run Key from Download
item.description: Detects the suspicious RUN keys created by software located in Download or temporary Outlook/Internet Explorer directories

item.title: Suspicious Service Installed
item.description: Detects installation of NalDrv or PROCEXP152 services via registry-keys to non-system32 folders. Both services are used in the tool Ghost-In-The-Logs (https://github.com/bats3c/Ghost-In-The-Logs), which uses KDU (https://github.com/hfiref0x/KDU)

item.title: Sysinternals SDelete Registry Keys
item.description: A General detection to trigger for the creation or modification of .*\Software\Sysinternals\SDelete registry keys. Indicators of the use of Sysinternals SDelete tool.

item.title: UAC Bypass Via Wsreset
item.description: Unfixed method for UAC bypass from windows 10. WSReset.exe file associated with the Windows Store. It will run a binary file contained in a low-privilege registry.

item.title: VBScript Payload Stored in Registry
item.description: Detects VBScript content stored into registry keys as seen being used by UNC2452 group

item.title: Wdigest CredGuard Registry Modification
item.description: Detects potential malicious modification of the property value of IsCredGuardEnabled from HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\SecurityProviders\WDigest to disable Cred Guard on a system. This is usually used with UseLogonCredential to manipulate the caching credentials.

item.title: Wdigest Enable UseLogonCredential
item.description: Detects potential malicious modification of the property value of UseLogonCredential from HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\SecurityProviders\WDigest to enable clear-text credentials
